intro: Digomphotis undulata, commonly known as the undulating sandbur, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, spiny bracts and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to dry conditions. Its life cycle is annual, with seeds dispersing via the wind or through attachment to animals. The plant plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
